---
title: 'Text Formatting in R Markdown'
output: html_document

Type freely to produce a plain text. End a line with two spaces to start a new paragraph. These are the commonly used text formatting:

**Bold**

*italic*

~~striketrough~~

`verbatim code`

> block quote

# Header 1
## Header 2
### Header 3 (you can make Header 1-6)

<https://www.algorit.ma>

[Algoritma website](algorit.ma)

image inline ![](assets/notebook-insert-chunk.png) or image below:

![Caption](assets/image/logo/logo-algo.png)

* Bullet list:
    + sub-item 1
    + sub-item 2
        - sub-sub-item1
* Continue bullet .. 

1. Numbered list:
      i) sub-item 1
          a. sub-sub-item1
2. Continue number..

Insert a footnote here[^1]

[^1]: explain a footnote
